trans-unit.source: Attestation Signing a Kernel Driver for Public Release
trans-unit.target: Attestation Signing a Kernel Driver for Public Release

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to sign a driver using attestation signing via the Windows Hardware Developer Center Dashboard web portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to sign a driver using attestation signing via the Windows Hardware Developer Center Dashboard web portal.

trans-unit.source: Note Attestation signing has the following properties.
trans-unit.target: Note Attestation signing has the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Attestation signing supports Windows 10 Desktop kernel mode and user mode drivers.
trans-unit.target: Attestation signing supports Windows 10 Desktop kernel mode and user mode drivers.

trans-unit.source: Although user mode drivers do not need to be signed by Microsoft for Windows 10, the same attestation process can be used for both user and kernel mode drivers.
trans-unit.target: Although user mode drivers do not need to be signed by Microsoft for Windows 10, the same attestation process can be used for both user and kernel mode drivers.

trans-unit.source: Attestation signing requires the use of an EV Certificate to submit the driver to the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Attestation signing requires the use of an EV Certificate to submit the driver to the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: An attestation signed driver will only work for Windows 10 Desktop, it will not work for other versions of Windows, such as Windows Server 2016, Windows 8.1, or Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: An attestation signed driver will only work for Windows 10 Desktop, it will not work for other versions of Windows, such as Windows Server 2016, Windows 8.1, or Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Attestation Signing a Kernel Mode Driver
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Attestation Signing a Kernel Mode Driver

trans-unit.source: To attestation sign a kernel mode driver complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To attestation sign a kernel mode driver complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Acquire an EV Code Signing Certificate
trans-unit.target: Acquire an EV Code Signing Certificate

trans-unit.source: Register your company for Windows Hardware Dashboard Services
trans-unit.target: Register your company for Windows Hardware Dashboard Services

trans-unit.source: Download and install the Windows Driver Kit
trans-unit.target: Download and install the Windows Driver Kit

trans-unit.source: Create a CAB files submission
trans-unit.target: Create a CAB files submission

trans-unit.source: Sign the CAB file submission with your EV Cert
trans-unit.target: Sign the CAB file submission with your EV Cert

trans-unit.source: Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard

trans-unit.source: Validate that the driver was properly signed
trans-unit.target: Validate that the driver was properly signed

trans-unit.source: Test your driver on Windows 10 for Desktop
trans-unit.target: Test your driver on Windows 10 for Desktop

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Acquire an EV Code Signing Certificate
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Acquire an EV Code Signing Certificate

trans-unit.source: Before you can submit binaries files using the dashboard to be signed, you need to acquire an extended validation (EV) code signing certificate to secure your digital information.
trans-unit.target: Before you can submit binaries files using the dashboard to be signed, you need to acquire an extended validation (EV) code signing certificate to secure your digital information.

trans-unit.source: This certificate is the accepted standard for establishing your company’s ownership of the code you submit.
trans-unit.target: This certificate is the accepted standard for establishing your company’s ownership of the code you submit.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to digitally sign PE binaries, such as .exe, .cab, .dll, .ocx, .msi, .xpi and .xap files.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to digitally sign PE binaries, such as .exe, .cab, .dll, .ocx, .msi, .xpi and .xap files.

trans-unit.source: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Get a code signing certificate</linkText><title></title></link> to acquire the needed EV code signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Get a code signing certificate</linkText><title></title></link> to acquire the needed EV code signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Register your company for Windows Hardware Dashboard Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Register your company for Windows Hardware Dashboard Services

trans-unit.source: You can certify your devices and apps for hardware certification using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can certify your devices and apps for hardware certification using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: To access the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard, you’ll need to register your company and get a code signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: To access the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard, you’ll need to register your company and get a code signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Before You Sign In</linkText><title></title></link> to set up the account you will need on the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Before You Sign In</linkText><title></title></link> to set up the account you will need on the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html> Download and install the Windows Driver Kit
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html> Download and install the Windows Driver Kit

trans-unit.source: You will need to download and install the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) to gain access to tools that are used to sign binary files.
trans-unit.target: You will need to download and install the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) to gain access to tools that are used to sign binary files.

trans-unit.source: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Download kits and tools for Windows 10</linkText><title></title></link> to download and install the WDK.
trans-unit.target: Follow the process described in <link><linkText>Download kits and tools for Windows 10</linkText><title></title></link> to download and install the WDK.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Create a CAB Files Submission
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Create a CAB Files Submission

trans-unit.source: To create a CAB files submission for the dashboard complete the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To create a CAB files submission for the dashboard complete the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Gather the binaries that you will submit to be signed in a single directory.
trans-unit.target: Gather the binaries that you will submit to be signed in a single directory.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we will use C:\\Echo.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we will use C:\\Echo.

trans-unit.source: The steps described here, will reference the echo driver available in GitHub at this location.
trans-unit.target: The steps described here, will reference the echo driver available in GitHub at this location.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>https://github.com/Microsoft/Windows-driver-samples/tree/master/general/echo/kmdf/driver/AutoSync</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>https://github.com/Microsoft/Windows-driver-samples/tree/master/general/echo/kmdf/driver/AutoSync</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Typical cab file submissions contain the following.
trans-unit.target: Typical cab file submissions contain the following.

trans-unit.source: The driver itself, for example Echo.sys
trans-unit.target: The driver itself, for example Echo.sys

trans-unit.source: The driver INF file that is used by the dashboard to facilitate the signing process.
trans-unit.target: The driver INF file that is used by the dashboard to facilitate the signing process.

trans-unit.source: Catalog .CAT files are not required.
trans-unit.target: Catalog .CAT files are not required.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft regenerates catalog files and replaces any catalog files that were submitted.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft regenerates catalog files and replaces any catalog files that were submitted.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft provided replacement catalog is also signed.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft provided replacement catalog is also signed.

trans-unit.source: Use MakeCab.exe to process the DDF file and create a cab file.
trans-unit.target: Use MakeCab.exe to process the DDF file and create a cab file.

trans-unit.source: Open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Then enter the following command to view the MakeCab options:
trans-unit.target: Then enter the following command to view the MakeCab options:

trans-unit.source: MakeCab /?
trans-unit.target: MakeCab /?

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html>C:\Echo> MakeCab /?
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html>C:\Echo> MakeCab /?

trans-unit.source: Cabinet Maker - Lossless Data Compression Tool
trans-unit.target: Cabinet Maker - Lossless Data Compression Tool

trans-unit.source: MAKECAB [/V[n]] <link><linkText>/D var=value ...[/l dir]</linkText><title></title></link> source [destination]
trans-unit.target: MAKECAB [/V[n]] <link><linkText>/D var=value ...[/l dir]</linkText><title></title></link> source [destination]

trans-unit.source: MAKECAB [/V[n]] [/D var=value ...] /F directive_file [...]
trans-unit.target: MAKECAB [/V[n]] [/D var=value ...] /F directive_file [...]

trans-unit.source: source File to compress.
trans-unit.target: source File to compress.

trans-unit.source: destination File name to give compressed file.
trans-unit.target: destination File name to give compressed file.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, the
trans-unit.target: If omitted, the

trans-unit.source: last character of the source file name is replaced
trans-unit.target: last character of the source file name is replaced

trans-unit.source: with an underscore (_) and used as the destination.
trans-unit.target: with an underscore (_) and used as the destination.

trans-unit.source: /F directives A file with MakeCAB directives (may be repeated).
trans-unit.target: /F directives A file with MakeCAB directives (may be repeated).

trans-unit.source: Refer to
trans-unit.target: Refer to

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Cabinet SDK for information on directive_file.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Cabinet SDK for information on directive_file.

trans-unit.source: /D var=value Defines variable with specified value.
trans-unit.target: /D var=value Defines variable with specified value.

trans-unit.source: /L dir Location to place destination (default is current directory).
trans-unit.target: /L dir Location to place destination (default is current directory).

trans-unit.source: /V[n] Verbosity level (1..3).<html></html><html></html><html></html>
trans-unit.target: /V[n] Verbosity level (1..3).<html></html><html></html><html></html>

trans-unit.source: Prepare a cab file DDF input file.
trans-unit.target: Prepare a cab file DDF input file.

trans-unit.source: For our Echo driver it might look something like this.
trans-unit.target: For our Echo driver it might look something like this.

trans-unit.source: ;* Echo.ddf example ; .OPTION EXPLICIT ; Generate errors .Set CabinetFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderSizeThreshold=0 .Set MaxCabinetSize=0 .Set MaxDiskFileCount=0 .Set MaxDiskSize=0 .Set CompressionType=MSZIP .Set Cabinet=on .Set Compress=on ;Specify file name for new cab file .Set CabinetNameTemplate=Echo.cab ;Specify files to be included in cab file C:\Echo\Echo.Inf C:\Echo\Echo.Sys
trans-unit.target: ;* Echo.ddf example ; .OPTION EXPLICIT ; Generate errors .Set CabinetFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderSizeThreshold=0 .Set MaxCabinetSize=0 .Set MaxDiskFileCount=0 .Set MaxDiskSize=0 .Set CompressionType=MSZIP .Set Cabinet=on .Set Compress=on ;Specify file name for new cab file .Set CabinetNameTemplate=Echo.cab ;Specify files to be included in cab file C:\Echo\Echo.Inf C:\Echo\Echo.Sys

trans-unit.source: Note* All driver folders in your cab must support the same set of architectures, for example, all drivers must be x86 or all drivers must be x64, or all drivers must support both x86 and x64.
trans-unit.target: Note* All driver folders in your cab must support the same set of architectures, for example, all drivers must be x86 or all drivers must be x64, or all drivers must support both x86 and x64.

trans-unit.source: Call the makecab utility and provide the ddf file as input using the /f option.
trans-unit.target: Call the makecab utility and provide the ddf file as input using the /f option.

trans-unit.source: C:\Echo> MakeCab /f "C:\Echo\Echo.ddf
trans-unit.target: C:\Echo> MakeCab /f "C:\Echo\Echo.ddf

trans-unit.source: The output of makecab should display the number of files in the created cabinet, in our example 2.
trans-unit.target: The output of makecab should display the number of files in the created cabinet, in our example 2.

trans-unit.source:
C:\Echo> MakeCab /f Echo.ddf Cabinet Maker - Lossless Data Compression Tool
17,682 bytes in 2 files Total files: 2 Bytes before: 17,682 Bytes after: 7,374 After/Before: 41.70% compression Time: 0.20 seconds ( 0 hr 0 min 0.20 sec) Throughput: 86.77 Kb/second
trans-unit.target:
C:\Echo> MakeCab /f Echo.ddf Cabinet Maker - Lossless Data Compression Tool
17,682 bytes in 2 files Total files: 2 Bytes before: 17,682 Bytes after: 7,374 After/Before: 41.70% compression Time: 0.20 seconds ( 0 hr 0 min 0.20 sec) Throughput: 86.77 Kb/second

trans-unit.source: Locate the cab file in the Disk1 subdirectory.
trans-unit.target: Locate the cab file in the Disk1 subdirectory.

trans-unit.source: You can click the cab file in File Explorer to verify that it contains the expected files.
trans-unit.target: You can click the cab file in File Explorer to verify that it contains the expected files.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Sign the Submission Cab File with your EV Cert
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Sign the Submission Cab File with your EV Cert

trans-unit.source: Use the process recommended by the EV cert provider to sign the cab file with your EV cert.
trans-unit.target: Use the process recommended by the EV cert provider to sign the cab file with your EV cert.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might use the signtool and if you are using Verisign, you might specify their timestamp server.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might use the signtool and if you are using Verisign, you might specify their timestamp server.

trans-unit.source: C:\Echo> SignTool sign /v /s MY /n "Subject Name of the Signing Certificate" /t http://timestamp.verisign.com/scripts/timstamp.dll "C:\Echo\Disk1\Echo.cab"
trans-unit.target: C:\Echo> SignTool sign /v /s MY /n "Subject Name of the Signing Certificate" /t http://timestamp.verisign.com/scripts/timstamp.dll "C:\Echo\Disk1\Echo.cab"

trans-unit.source: Note Use industry best practices to mange the security of the EV cert signing process.
trans-unit.target: Note Use industry best practices to mange the security of the EV cert signing process.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard

trans-unit.source: Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Submit the EV signed Cab file using the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link><linkText>Driver Signing Properties</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>File Signing Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link><linkText>Driver Signing Properties</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>File Signing Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: As part of the submission process you will indicate what architectures all of the drivers in the submission support.
trans-unit.target: As part of the submission process you will indicate what architectures all of the drivers in the submission support.

trans-unit.source: Three options are available using the check boxes.
trans-unit.target: Three options are available using the check boxes.

trans-unit.source: x86 and x64
trans-unit.target: x86 and x64

trans-unit.source: All driver folders in your cab must support the same set of architectures, for example, all drivers must be x86 or all drivers must be x64 or support both x86 and x64.
trans-unit.target: All driver folders in your cab must support the same set of architectures, for example, all drivers must be x86 or all drivers must be x64 or support both x86 and x64.

trans-unit.source: If you have drivers that support different combinations of architectures, create separate submissions.
trans-unit.target: If you have drivers that support different combinations of architectures, create separate submissions.

trans-unit.source: You will also indicate if you are submitting universal drivers.
trans-unit.target: You will also indicate if you are submitting universal drivers.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, <link><linkText>Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see, <link><linkText>Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following screen shot shows the options for submitting the echo driver for signing.
trans-unit.target: The following screen shot shows the options for submitting the echo driver for signing.

trans-unit.source: When the signing process is complete, download your signed driver from the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: When the signing process is complete, download your signed driver from the Hardware Dev Center Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Validate that the driver was properly signed
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Validate that the driver was properly signed

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps to validate that the driver was properly signed.
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps to validate that the driver was properly signed.

trans-unit.source: After you have downloaded the submission file, extract the driver file.
trans-unit.target: After you have downloaded the submission file, extract the driver file.

trans-unit.source: Open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a Command Prompt window as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Then enter the following command to verify that the driver was signed as expected.
trans-unit.target: Then enter the following command to verify that the driver was signed as expected.

trans-unit.source: C:\Echo> SignTool verify Echo.Sys
trans-unit.target: C:\Echo> SignTool verify Echo.Sys

trans-unit.source: To list additional information and have signtool verify all signatures in a file with multiple signatures, type the following.
trans-unit.target: To list additional information and have signtool verify all signatures in a file with multiple signatures, type the following.

trans-unit.source: C:\Echo> SignTool verify /pa /ph /v /d Echo.Sys
trans-unit.target: C:\Echo> SignTool verify /pa /ph /v /d Echo.Sys

trans-unit.source: To confirm the EKUs of the driver complete the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To confirm the EKUs of the driver complete the following steps.

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Open Windows Explorer and locate the binary file.
trans-unit.target: Open Windows Explorer and locate the binary file.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the file and select Properties.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the file and select Properties.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: On the Digital Signatures tab, select the listed item in the Signature list.
trans-unit.target: On the Digital Signatures tab, select the listed item in the Signature list.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Select the Details button, and then select View Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Select the Details button, and then select View Certificate.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: On the Details tab, select the Enhanced Key Usage field.
trans-unit.target: On the Details tab, select the Enhanced Key Usage field.

trans-unit.source: When the driver is resigned by the dashboard the following process is used.
trans-unit.target: When the driver is resigned by the dashboard the following process is used.

trans-unit.source: Appends a Microsoft SHA2 embedded signature.
trans-unit.target: Appends a Microsoft SHA2 embedded signature.

trans-unit.source: If the driver binaries are embedded signed by the customer with their own certificates, those signatures will not be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: If the driver binaries are embedded signed by the customer with their own certificates, those signatures will not be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: Creates and signs a new catalog file with a SHA2 Microsoft certificate.
trans-unit.target: Creates and signs a new catalog file with a SHA2 Microsoft certificate.

trans-unit.source: This catalog replaces any existing catalog provided by the customer.
trans-unit.target: This catalog replaces any existing catalog provided by the customer.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Test your driver on Windows 10 for Desktop
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Test your driver on Windows 10 for Desktop

trans-unit.source: Use the following instructions to install the sample driver.
trans-unit.target: Use the following instructions to install the sample driver.

trans-unit.source: Open Device Manager, right click on the computer icon and select "Add legacy Hardware".
trans-unit.target: Open Device Manager, right click on the computer icon and select "Add legacy Hardware".

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to complete the install of the driver.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to complete the install of the driver.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, open a Command Prompt window as Administrator and use devcon to install the driver.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, open a Command Prompt window as Administrator and use devcon to install the driver.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your driver package folder, and enter the following command.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your driver package folder, and enter the following command.

trans-unit.source: C:\Echo> devcon install echo.inf root\ECHO
trans-unit.target: C:\Echo> devcon install echo.inf root\ECHO

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the driver install process does not display the "Windows can't verify the publisher of this driver software."
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the driver install process does not display the "Windows can't verify the publisher of this driver software."

trans-unit.source: Windows security dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Windows security dialog box.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Create a Multiple Driver Submission
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html><html></html>Create a Multiple Driver Submission

trans-unit.source: To submit multiple drivers at the same time, create a sub directory for each driver as shown below.
trans-unit.target: To submit multiple drivers at the same time, create a sub directory for each driver as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Submitting debug pdb symbol files for signing is optional.
trans-unit.target: Submitting debug pdb symbol files for signing is optional.

trans-unit.source: Prepare a cab file DDF input file that references the subdirectories.
trans-unit.target: Prepare a cab file DDF input file that references the subdirectories.

trans-unit.source: It might look something like this.
trans-unit.target: It might look something like this.

trans-unit.source: ;* Submission.ddf multiple driver example ; .OPTION EXPLICIT ; Generate errors .Set CabinetFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderSizeThreshold=0 .Set MaxCabinetSize=0 .Set MaxDiskFileCount=0 .Set MaxDiskSize=0 .Set CompressionType=MSZIP .Set Cabinet=on .Set Compress=on ;Specify file name for new cab file .Set CabinetNameTemplate=Echo.cab ;Specify files to be included in cab file ; First Driver C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage1\Driver1.sys C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage1\Driver1.inf ; Second driver C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage2\Driver2.sys C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage2\Driver2.inf ; Optional Symbols C:\DriverFiles\Symbols\Driver1.pdb C:\DriverFiles\Symbols\Driver2.pdb
trans-unit.target: ;* Submission.ddf multiple driver example ; .OPTION EXPLICIT ; Generate errors .Set CabinetFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderFileCountThreshold=0 .Set FolderSizeThreshold=0 .Set MaxCabinetSize=0 .Set MaxDiskFileCount=0 .Set MaxDiskSize=0 .Set CompressionType=MSZIP .Set Cabinet=on .Set Compress=on ;Specify file name for new cab file .Set CabinetNameTemplate=Echo.cab ;Specify files to be included in cab file ; First Driver C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage1\Driver1.sys C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage1\Driver1.inf ; Second driver C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage2\Driver2.sys C:\DriverFiles\DriverPackage2\Driver2.inf ; Optional Symbols C:\DriverFiles\Symbols\Driver1.pdb C:\DriverFiles\Symbols\Driver2.pdb

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps previously described to sign, submit and test the driver files.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps previously described to sign, submit and test the driver files.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Related topics
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Related topics

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Signing a Driver</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Signing a Driver</linkText><title></title></link>
